review: I like Red Robin, usually.  It is a great place to take the kids.  It's loud, so it's okay if your baby cries, etc.  My 3 year old loves the chicken on a stick with broccoli.  This visit wasn't as good for me, though.  I had the fried chicken salad, my usual, but it didn't sit well this time.  I was RUNNING for the bathroom when I got home!

Let me preface this by saying that I really am not a Red Robin fan.  Never have been.  But, on a recent Wednesday evening while out running around, the family and I got a crazy urge to go to Red Robin.  I don't know why.  I wanted a burger and no one else had any opposition, so away we went.   We arrived around 7 pm and were told there would be a 15 minute wait and that was fairly accurate.  Once we were seated, we were promptly greeted by Amanda C., who was attentive and friendly all evening.  We started with an appetizer of cheese sticks and onion rings and both were a big hit.  It was actually a great deal.  For $5.99, we got five cheese sticks and a half dozen or so pretty big onion rings.  All were gone quickly.   For dinner, my wife ordered a petite burger, which is good for her appetite.  The only complaint was that it was really just a kids burger for which they charged us only one dollar less than the regular while the kids meals were several dollars cheaper.  I'll just make her order the kids meal next time!  The kids had a burger and chicken fingers and both were gone in no time.  I had a bacon guacamole burger of some sort and it was quite good.  My wife didn't like the fries much but I did.  I just wish I hadn't stuffed myself on appetizers because I didn't take advantage of the "bottomless" option.  I didn't even order another round of fries.  20-year old Lance would be ashamed. After we got home, my oldest son asked when we could go back to Red Robin because in his words, "everyone seemed to enjoy it".  And you know what, I have to agree.  Everyone did enjoy it.  And while I am not a truly a 'fan', I would definitely return if the urge hits.  It was a pleasant night out.

Just wanted to update my posting. Red Robin has redeemed themselves!! Outstanding service and great burgers. Not sure what happened the last time. We have been back twice since then and both times have had a great time!

So I'm guessing, more like hoping, that Red Robin opened their eyes. We went back only because my boyfriend wanted a burger so we tried this place AGAIN. We were extremely hesitant but wow have they changed. The burgers actually have more flavor and the fry situation, well let's just say there isn't one anymore. Everyone at the table gets their own portion now and not just a pathetic communal basket with 5 fries in it. My parents came in from where they don't have a Red Robin and they loved it. The onion rings are some of the best that we have had thus far and the BBQ burger........ left me speechless. I don't know what prompted Red Robin to "change" but whatever it was, hopefully Yelp, I like it.

Every time I've eaten here I've sat at the bar and the service is always quick and friendly. I've never had to ask for refills and the burgers come out tasty every time!! My favorite burger joint in Hampton roads hands down!

Well, this place is not the healthiest place to eat, but it sure is yummy! Great fried shrimp and chicken and of course their signature milkshakes. I dare say their milkshakes bring all the boys to the yard! ;)  While my husband was waiting there for me to arrive he accidentally scored a small gash on his ankle from a bolt that sticking out of the ground. He let them know about it inside and the manager comped us with a free appetizer. The pretzel bits were very good with melted cheese for dipping! By the time we left I saw that they had properly secured the bolt in question and even gave my hubby a bandaid. Good job Red Robin!

I have been to many Red Robin's all over. The main complaint that I have over and over again is that everything comes out COLD. I want HOT fries, like so hot you have to let them cool.  I do not understand how they can cook food but everything always comes out cold. Maybe it is their system of letting it sit before it is delivered. I do not know.  I normally get a burger or a wrap. My most recent visit, I got a burger. Yet again, burger is Cold. I think it is totally that they take the burger off the grill, let it cool, and then put it on a cold bun. Then let it sit before they serve it. I WANT HOT FOOD.  So as our burgers were being placed in front of us by the food runner, I say to my friend, that the one thing that annoys me is that Red Robin's burgers always come out cold. Every restaurant, every time, they are cold. Without even saying anything to us, the food runner alerts the manager our burgers are cold. So the manager comes out, offers to remake, which I explain will do no good since the replacements will come out cold. I explain that its their delivery system that keeps the food cold.  The manager said our burgers would be free! Nice.  The service was excellent, we never had to ask for refills on drinks, and we were offered fries.  My only complaint is their system. However, they keep the fries warm after they take them out of the fryer does not work, and their waiting to let food cool for delivery is terrible.  The food is good, it is just COLD.

It's Red Robin.. what can you say.. YUMMMM!!!  the Royal is my tried and true burger when I hit RR.  Nothing like brunch on a bun to slow the blood a little.  Of course, with their new choices in buns, having mine on the jalapeno gave it a little zing.    May have to go back and review some of the other flavors...

Subpar. Meat did not taste good, but I did like being able to choose what type of bun it came on. Fries were mediocre at best, after I drenched them in seasoning salt. Service was not so great. Go to five guys instead!

I use to LOVE RR when I was a kid!! You know- back when the ONLY thing I ate was chicken tenders.......ya.  These days I have more refined taste and sadly- RR just doesn't do it for me. Greasy burger with blandish toppings. Normal fries. Shake. It's the same flavor at a half dozen other joints. Not really anything to be excited about.  MEH.

A great place to eat if you want good authentic burgers.  I would have enjoyed it that much more if it weren't for the disgusting person sitting in front of me coughing all over my food and blowing his nose, YUCK!  I'm typically not a rude person, so I just politely asked for my food to go and threw it away and washed my hands and face once I got home.   Gross!

I don't know what's up with this place,  but everytime my husband and I go the service is slow.   The fries are pretty good,  but I haven't had a burger here yet to knock my socks off.  Complimentary burger in your birthday month. NICE!

This is about the 2nd time in 6 months that I've visited the Greenbrier Red Robin. All of my visits have been average, about a 3 star experience.  The last visit was not that and a combination of things pursued me to give RR-GB a 2 star rating. First, I wonder when did RR-GB become a nightclub.  As we approached the host/hostess podium, we were asked if everyone in our party was over 21.  The explanation only came after I asked, "Why?".  Well, apparently, you can only eat in the bar area if you are over 21 years of age.  Does that mean if you say, "Yes!", that no one will check your ID? Maybe people of age have been sharing their adult beverages with their underage brethren.  Who knows; it was never fully explained, so we took our place in the dining room. I'm somewhat forgiving if I see the wait person hustling and ours was burning holes in her shoes, it seemed, trying to service her tables.  It was hard, however, to get glasses filled and for her to remember things that we requested for the table.  She touched our table less than most too. All of the food was OK except my Royal Red Robin Burger.  First, I wanted the egg over medium.  Our waitperson said it only comes sunnyside up or over hard.  Why, I wondered?  How much work does it take to flip an egg and pull it before the yolk hardens?  Well, the 'new' manager happen to be cruising by and heard my order; she said, "Oh, we can do that!"  The wait person started to back peddle, "Well, she's new and we were told we couldn't do that."  That was a sign of things to come.  I also asked for the burger to come to the table 'Cantina style' - green chilies and pepper jack cheese. After a longish wait, the burgers arrived.  My burger hit the table last with a sunnyside up egg and American cheese.  I immediately reminded our wait person what my order was; she reacted by reached for the plate and I stopped her.  I didn't want to wait for a re-do, anticipating a long wait, so I took it 'as-is' and asked for the chilies and pepper jack on the side.  After all the discussion about how I wanted my burger, I had to just scratch my head; why can't the kitchen get this right?  I have to assume that our wait person didn't put it in the POS system correctly; wouldn't you? We sat forever, it seemed, as we waiting for takeout containers and the checks. My chilies and pepper jack was added to someone else's check then credited on the same check.  WHAT?  No harm, no foul, I guess...I was ready to get out of RR-GB. Our visit to RR-GB has some major hiccups.  They have been in this location long enough to have these things worked out; I personally expected better. Maybe I should put some space between this and my next visit.  What would you do?

It had been years since we tried Red Robin, for no particular reason...but we were both craving a burger so why not.  This location isn't very visible from the street but not it's hidden either. I guess for me it just kinda blends, which could've been one of the reasons we hadn't come by sooner. When we walked inside it was nearly a full house so we had to wait a bit in the front seating area. It was clean and comfortable and it didn't take too long. The staff was extremely friendly from the hostess to the server but we did have a bit of a delay from the time our order went in to the time it arrived.  The burgers are either pick from the menu or build your own and since we did a combination of building onto what they offered there's not much reason to talk specifics about our burger order...other than to say it was very good but not great. The fries were about the same and we both really liked the onion rings. Overall it was good time with good food and great staff so we'll probably be back soon.

Pretty delicious! I got the burger with the bleu cheese on it& I got a pumpkin spice milk shake. It was Great!  I also ordered a side of pickles( I'm pregnant) and they were great as well. Service was fantastic & I only have 4 stars due to the table having leafs and I think we could have had better seating.

Good burgers but every time we come we get the seat by the door! Even on the slow days. We have gone 5 times and at least 4 time we had to sit by the door not fun in the winter time. I should have to argue when I ask for another seat especially when it's slow and plenty of open seats.

Omg there burgers are great. They make a variety of burgers and other dishes. What I really liked was, any burger on the menu could be made with beef or turkey. The burger were fresh and tasty, the fries were also fresh and tasty. You also have a great selection of dipping sauces for your fries. The thousand island, ranch, and the Thai chilli sauce was the best.  I tried one of there speciality drinks called Mango Moscato Shack.  Omg that drink was everything.....if you come here it is a must you try this drink.   I will definitely come here again.

Whenever I go to Red Robin, I am forced to listen to at least 5 birthday songs and I think it's great.  On another note...the BLTA is my favorite sandwich of all time and if you dare eat the mile high mudd pie thingy, you will get a stomach ache. Don't blame the mudd pie.  It is YOU who are in control of what goes into YOUR mouth.  That being said, it still may be worth it.  It is decadent.

Let me start by saying that we tried Red Robin for the first time when our kids were a tad younger. We thought then, ehh, it's just another burger joint. Past forward and we came back and we've been a regular customer! I guess our taste buds have changed and we love coming back for more. I'm a sucker for a big juicy burger and partial to my usual bacon cheeseburger. Lately though, I'm in to a bit spicy food and tried their Burnin' Love burger. Not disappointed..gobbled it all!  Our hostess was so attentive and checked on us many many times. Great burgers and they have a wide variety to choose from. Build it as you like. One of our favorite burger joint! We will be back...
We can get better burgers at 5 guys. Also, Red Robin's salads are quite disappointing.

This location was not impressive nor was it anywhere close to the Red Robin standard. Table tops and booths are cleaner but service is just not there. The a/c vents blow air to strong and cold to enjoy food before it becomes cold. We ordered the creamy artichoke & spinach dip, the smoke & pepper burger, and the gourmet cheeseburger. The creamy artichoke & spinach dip was too salty, with some soggy tortilla chips, and rotten celery sticks. Sometimes I don't understand how vegetables can be served when they are clear as day bad. The smoke and pepper burger itself was very good. The beef patty has lots of smoke flavor. Very nice! However, the sweet potato fries were soggy and cold, as though our order had been sitting for ten minutes before  arriving at our table.  The gourmet burger. I ordered this because I wanted to try "the original". It was unsatisfying for a few reasons: (1) waitress didn't offer the different buns available, (2) it was flavorless, (3) wasn't it supposed to come with tomato? Maybe the cook was sleeping, (4) I think you get the idea. The burger came with bottomless fries but the refill didn't arrive until right before we were ready to leave. Husband's freckled lemonade ran empty three times and it could've been filled at least three more times but our waitress was nowhere to be found. Just like waiting for the check, more than ten minutes. Service was seriously poor, but we still left her a tip. Sad story. One thing about big restaurants--why build big if you don't have enough employees to work it? $46.
Very dirty. Drinking glasses smelled like dish water. Flys where all around the table. Service was good but who wants to eat in an environment like that??

I come here all the time. About 3 times a month. The place is clean, not sure why someone said that about flies and the glasses being dirty. The raspberry tea is amazing.  Staff is super friendly, and will always make sure that your glass stays full!  We always get the same thing, a whiskey river salad for me and a whiskey river burger for my husband.  They're great about leaving certain things out of my salad due to allergies. Gotta love the bottomless fries!!

Unimpressed.   Went here for lunch on Saturday (1130).   The restaurant was half full.  We we seated and after about 5 minutes the waitress came.  She apologized for being slow as she put it "we are busy".  So after she brought our drunks she took our order.  I had the blue ribbon that was supposed to be cooked medium buy was actually rare.  Both the burger and fries were warm, not hot.  I would have brought it to the attention of our waitress but she was not too attentive and slow.  We ordered more of the bottomless fries and luckily they were hot.   Overall I thought trying a different Red Robin to see if it was any different from the one close to home.  Unfortunately it wasn't.  Although the burger had good flavor but served just warm,  I think it will be a while before I visit any Red Robin again.

Normally love this location. But didn't have a good experience today. The waitress wasn't very nice, and our food was cold. When we got in remade it was still not hot. But it was really busy and you could see the kitchen had all the food up and prepared it just sat for a while. We love red robin just today wasn't the best we've had.

I stopped in here last night to join some friends celebrating a birthday. This is my first visit here in quite a few years as I tend to prefer non-chain establishments but I have to say that I had one heck of a tasty burger. Our server was friendly and took good care of us throughout the visit which I'm sure wasn't easy because the place was packed. All in all 4 stars.

eh, I used to love this place but it sort of fell off. The fries had that old taste to it, and the burger was so greasy the bun was extremely soggy. Not edible. The waitress took it to make me another order, but I was wanting to just go ahead and cancel it and just pay for my beer. I didn't like the waitress too much, but it's fine cause I'll prob not come here again.

We come to this location frequently and have noticed lately that unless Ema or another male server (can't remember his name...has waited on us twice), the service is average, if that. This last visit was enough to make me reconsider visiting this location. The server was extremely unfriendly, inattentive, and after waiting a half an hour for our food, it was cold.  I would have given it two stars, but I know they have potential to serve good and hot food. It obviously takes the right server.

Not the place to go when you're actually hungry. The service is always slow on weekday afternoons even after the lunch rush. It gets three stars ONLY because the food and service is excellent at night.

The only problem I have had here, is that some of the  advertised menu items are not known by the waiting staff, and then when I've ordered some of their advertised featured items, the waiting staff would say "Let me go see if we have these".  I could understand on occasion this being an issue.. but it has become the NORMAL, not an "on occasion" thing.  **BE AWARE** Expect to get a generic tasting patty.. not one with flavor.. the flavor will come from all the side items you put on your burger ...  Create your own burger, and enjoy

Good French onion soup! Service is slow and they aren't too busy. Where are those bottomless fries they advertise? Non here. It's showing its age, TV in floor broken, seat cushion on our booth is ripped and it's not even taped over, our light fixture is even cracked and very dusty. We used to enjoy this place but it needs a face lift.

I went there a week ago and it was a great experience. I did have to wait 15 minutes to be seated, but it was on a weekend. Our server was very kind and brought our food in a timely manner. The milkshakes and burgers are killer good. I even branched out by getting sweet potato fries and WOW! Where have they been my whole life? Its bottomless fries too! In love. RED ROBIN.....YUMMM!!!

Waited bout 15 mins when there are empty tables, once sitted, waited another 10 mins to order, once food is served and ate all the fries waited another 10 mins for "bottomless" fries.  WAITING TIME = 35 minutes....

I rarely eat at Red Robin, for some odd reason (as I live close to it), so when I do I always try to recall how I felt about it.  When I went, I arrived with a group of three (myself included), and while there wasn't much of a crowd, we still had to wait a few minutes. Our waitress was patient and kind, which is always a plus, but when we arrived to our table there was an abandoned crayon on it, leading me to believe the tables weren't as clean as they could be. I had a raspberry sort of bubbly drink with whipped cream on top that is weirdly not on the online menu-- it was delicious, but no free refills on it. My partner had a "Poppin' Purple Lemonade" that was also great and DID have free refills. The glasses were adorable.  Food wasn't anything to rave about. I had a "Royal Red Robin" burger, which is the burger with an egg. The egg and bacon were pretty good, everything else was fine; a house salad instead of fries with MORE than enough cucumbers than ANYONE could ever want or need. Partner had hot wings, the third person I was with had a grilled turkey burger which was also okay. Whole ordeal was alright. Drinks were good and the service was nice-- though our waitress had to leave and the guy that replaced her got a bit too close and intimate. The server was very pleasant as well.

Food was great until our waiter made a mistake and swiped my credit card with someone else check messing up my account by 3 dollars didn't get n e discount nothing but happy to hear the manager tell the people who paid our check with there credit card it was only 3 dollars off so it's ok...... Was pissed $3.00 is $3.00

So here we are again and hard to believe it was even worse than the bad experience we had here 7 months ago.  Today when we sat down the table was still wet from the cleaning it received.   We asked if it can be dried, we got a dirty look from the hostess but she proceeded to wipe it dry.  The napkin she used was black with dirt when she was done.  We then waited for about 50 minutes for our food (I checked into Swarm when I placed my order so I know how long we waited).  In fact a waitress noticed how long we had been waiting and went to talk to the manager.  When he brought us the food he said they had a problem in the kitchen with one of the meals so they had to remake the other dishes to ensure they were hot.  However, one of the meals (mine) was completely cold.  At this point I just decided to forget it. The waitress was nice, I understand that it was the kitchen's fault and not hers.
Went there once, AWFUL. thought I would try it again, bad news. the service was ok, burgers not so great. Will not try it again.

Ok. So we asked for a booth with a high chair. One of the ladies up front, Rebecca was rude when telling us we had to wait. We ended up waiting for almost 30 minutes ( no one else waiting) when we asked if it was going to be any time soon she rolled her eyes at us. Our server, Mandy was great! Even though it was only her 5th day. She was the highlight of the meal, since 2 tables around us got their food before us. The food was very good, it usually is. But again, Rebecca was rude and very unpleasant.
Horribly crowded. They jammed us in the middle of 3 round tables and we are only able to use half the table to sit. This place is ridiculous.
free B-day burger also a free b-day sundae .. eat there 10 time with the red robin card and get a free meal at 10

I'm in love with this place. It's the perfect family restaurant,  friendly staff, delicious food, this location tends to be loud exp on weekends so if you want quiet I wouldn't recommend it. But other then that I have no complaints.

If you want to eat out don't waste your money here. My family of three came in to grab a quick bite, we should have just ate at home. We ordered our food the waitress was kind and prompt but that was the only thing here worth while. A man had brought me a lackluster version of a sangria and spilt it all over our silverware, he expected me to clean it up so I had to ask for clean sets because he would not correct his mistake. The food came out extremely cold so make sure you enjoy that when you go here. My daughter let me know that her food tasted like grease and my husband was disappointed by what they call a spicy burger. Please don't waste your well earned money here.

My daughter and I had a great meal here last night. Our server was very good. The restaurant was very busy, and our server was too but he easily kept our drinks filled and came back often to check ask if we needed anything. He was very pleasant, and I'm sorry that I do not recall his name. I am visiting in the area for Thanksgiving, but I know my daughter's family eats here  they are in the  area, so I'm sure she was pleased with the meal and good service.

Best burger I have had in town in many years. Last time we went it was so loud my ears were ringing. Every TV was cranked up. Everyone was yelling, children were screaming, oh my. Chucky Cheese would have been quieter. Did I mention it was loud? Service has always been good.

I've been to this red Robin several times and each time walked away wishing the burgers were better. This time I went with another person and got the red Robin burger medium rare. The burger was delivered and looked like it would be juicy but it was not. It's almost like the meat they are using is to lean. The fries are delicious and bottomless as the pitch goes.  The other order was the chicken tenders and they were very very dry. All in all a disappointing meal. They were very busy but I Think that is the norm. The food should be good and juicy regardless. I will give mad props to the server. He did a great job, was very friendly and kept our drinks filled even though they were really busy. I'll give this place one more try before I mark it off the list.

This was terrible. After we were seated someone finally came to our table 12 minutes later. Burgers cold, fries cold. The burgers for a gourmet joint were smaller than sonic burgers just down the street. Never again. Said the same thing in Idaho 7 years ago when we tried it for the first time. Cold food, small portions for $30.00 for two people. NEVER AGAIN.

You can't go wrong with ordering a stack of onion rings as an appetizer... YUMMM Decent burgers and fries.  On the night we came here, the service was sloooooow... apparently, it was the result of the manager on duty sending servers home before the restaurant got slammed with customers. Our server was really nice, but you can tell she was stressed out from being spread out too thin.

Ok so I am updating my review on Red Robins because since my first review we've gone back a few times after and have been disappointed with not just the food but the horrible customer service from the front host to the waitresses/waiters. We just went today and the host that welcomes you at the door --Sydney, was the rudest, most unprofessional host a restaurant can put in the front to greet. My family and I walked in, she barely even looked at us, grabbed a few menus and started walking to later come back and shout "I'm right here... come on" as if we knew we had to follow her. She made no eye or verbal contact except for giving us attitude. She was than asked to bring us kid coloring sheets and never delivered them. Her attitude was again unprofessional in every way.  The food has also gone down hill for me on taste and appearance. The fries had no flavor, and the amount served wasn't a fair amount for the price. The burgers weren't what you expected it to be... They were poorly put together!! The drinks were flat and to get a refill seem like forever.  My family and I won't be going back for a very long time, if not, ever again. We have experienced horrible customer service every time we have gone and it is not acceptable anymore!!! The lack of professionalism and polite/friendly customer services it's unbearable and they don't deserve to have my business.

Once seated our server, took EIGHT minutes to acknowledge our presence. She introduced herself as Olivia and OMG she appeared irritated when we wanted to order right away. I know there has to be some of us left that want to order right away. We ordered Diet Coke, 10 minutes on refills and Mac and cheese and my child had to ask for the refills on that item because again she appeared to be too busy with the guys next to us. They needed their fries. My husband sat without his fries for quite some time. Wait! My Diet Coke is empty again!! Uggghhh I'm so thirsty and I'm still noticing that the extra amount we paid for sweet potato fries obviously doesn't go to our server or the kitchen because the first batch took over 15 minutes. Please don't get me started on each subsequent batch of sweet potato fries. A male manager who appeared overwhelmed was in the kitchen trying to help. He ended up being out the second batch of sp fries when I told him that we were waiting yet AGAIN more than 10 minutes and then here comes Olivia (30 seconds after the manager) with sp fries and her response "wow you already have some, well now you have more" I'm shaking my head just thinking about this evening. I came back this evening because my name is Kristen and it was that corny gimmick if your name is close to St Nick Kris Kringle kind of thing but I'm going to be honest. I'd rather cook everyday for 2016 than to ever be served by Olivia again.

Haven't been to Red Robin in years,  It's near my area and I usually see their commercial,  but never had an urge to go there. I went there for dinner bc my sister and cousin were craving burgers and fries so I just tagged along. They have renovated stuff within their building, from what i noticed they created a partition wall near the bar and entrance, enclosed rather than open, changed the open table seating area with red tufted leather seats and a red table. As we entered there was a small wait,  and during that wait there was a confrontation between the hostess and another customer. #1 Never yell back at a customer, be professional even though they are wrong (#keepcalm)it's  bad for business. My entire impression: Had second thoughts about eating here and is that how am I gonna get treated here. As we sat down, we waited for our waitress for a long time maybe about 15-20 min. She finally got to us and took our orders. Another waitor or manager (couldn't tell)had brought us our food. My sister and I had ordered the Royal Burger, which is consisted of a meat patty cooked to your liking I got it cooked medium (little pink), cheese, lettuce and tomato (I got that on the side rather in the burger), and topped with a sunny-side-up egg (cooked on your preference,  I wanted over-easy), gave me the wrong cooked egg and had gotten an over-hard egg, which is basically a Sunny-side-up egg cooked all the way no runny yolk.  It also comes with bottomless fries, or you can choose another bottomless side, cost extra if its a premium side like sweet potato fries. The burger and fries were really good and it hit the spot.  Our waitress,  only took our orders, and checked on us 2x effortless. We would have to use the "call the server" button to get her. Bc she is no where to be seen. I felt the other waitor who delivered or food, helped us more than she did. He made sure I had gotten the egg correctly cooked.  My overall impression of this place is not all that great. Foods good, but if they can change the restauramt, they should start with the employees too.

Every burger I've ever ordered here has been delicious, bottomless fries are awesome,  and the shakes are good too. The service varies depending on what day and time you go, I've had some really great servers and some not so good. If you go during busy hours or on weekends you'll probably have to wait a while to be seated.

Bought 3 burgers in a to go order. Took a bite of mine, and it was nothing but onion straws, no burger. Drove back to get another burger that included the burger this time. The manager seemed deeply amused, while I was frustrated. Don't pay cash for your check, because I had no recompense for driving in circles for their screwup, and check that they gave you actual food in your to-go box. Won't be back.

I had the southern charm....... I rarely eat burgers but this place here....definitely great quality of service and food.   They had no problem accommodating our large party, we walked in as soon as they opened and all the staff was friendly and ready to go.  Great place for a post church meal.
Had Elizabeth as our server, she provided excellent customer service, especially towards my kids. She was quick to bring drinks and constantly stopped by, and was super friendly  Will visit again

To be honest I haven't had Red Robin in a long time, and I'm not a burger person but when I crave a juicy burger I've got to have one. So since Red Robin is pretty close to home, I came here with my sister and cousin for dinner. As we walked in, you get greeted by their hostess which was nice. But there was a customer that wasn't too happy so she started a confrontation with the hostess, the hostess tried to ignore her but the customer kept insisting to speak to a manager. Then that's when we saw the ugliness from the hostess, she started raising her voice as well. (I would have just went in the back and just grabbed the manager to deal with the customer instead of yelling back, especially in front of other customers that were waiting to be seated.) Anyways, let's talk about the burger. I love burgers with fried egg in it so I had to try there Royal Red Robin Burger. This burger was on point, since they top it with a fresh fried egg and applewood smoked bacon, gahhhh it's like breakfast in a burger. Delicious!!! I've also tried there Banzai Burger which is a teriyaki marinated patty topped with grilled pineapple. OH Em Gee, it's like being in the tropics having that pineapple on top of that sweet teriyaki burger!! Another must try Burger!! Oh I forgot to say, I use to work here so many years ago. I actually was one of the few that opened this store up. And man oh man, they have definitely changed and renovated the place. Looks so much better, but gotta say even if you make the place look better, they still have to have workers with better working attitudes. Had a waitress, that took our order and barely checked up on us. Let's just say, the food runner was a better waiter than the waitress we had. He made sure everything we had was the way we wanted it. I actually tipped him too! PRO: Burgers were deliciously made, just the way I like it. The renovation they did is really nice! CON: Work on hiring better workers or even teaching them the right way to treat customers!  OVERALL, service was horrible but the burgers were great. I'll probably come here for my last resort for burgers!

This is the worst quality of food I have ever experienced! After an extremely long, exhausting day of moving, I ordered a bbq chicken wrap and a bowl of mac n cheese to go. When I got home I discovered that the bowl of Mac n cheese was a bowl of noodles with absolutely nothing on them. Having just moved from out of state, with nothing in my refrigerator,  I had nothing to put on them to make them better. My bbq chicken wrap was a tortilla filled with plain white chicken and nothing else.

Though it's not my first place of choice for a burger, my kids always get excited to go there. Every thing just seems average there. Wait 25 minutes to get seated, but there were several open spots. The host staff could use some organizational help. They put all the large numbered families in the same spot. We asked to move to a booth instead. Elizabeth, our waitress, was great. Super friendly and attentive. I would give her 5 stars if I could. Food was good. And we will come back again.

Ever have one of those nights where nobody in the fam can agree on where they'd like to eat for dinner? That was us! No asian, no italian, no mexican, no seafood, no pizza! Uanimously, 30 minutes later, the good old juicy burger won!   It's been like forever, maybe several years, since l last ate at a Red Robin. The first few times I've been, I guess, just never did anything for me...UNTIL TODAY! I tried the Berserker X burger which is only offered for a limited time to promote the new Xmen movie that just came out. This surprisingly delicious  burger had sriracha onion straws, spicy pickles, cheddar cheese, L&T and a zesty aioli sauce all on a brioche bread. It was really, really, really good!! We ate at the bar since it was kinda packed in there. Good thing because our server/bartender was AWESOME! Red Robin was rockin' tonight!

Really cool spot especially sent I am closer to this area now. I really love how the var area is set up and everything it was definitely a nice area for me and my girlfriend to go hang out at drink some strawberry lemonade. Definitely would go again.

I went here last week and I am a big fan of this location. This is my second time here and both experiences were great. We had the bartender waiting on us on a high table/booth and she was vert attentive. We always had refills, checked on us the right amount of times and was very sweet. I just wasn't a big fan of how dark it was. Other than that I will be back to this location. And the milkshakes are amazing!!!

Came here while I was waiting to walk the mall with a girlfriend. I just so happened to have a free birthday burger so I thought this would be a great opportunity to use it! Was greeted by the host with a smile and who was happy to seat me in the bar.  My Server was super sweet about my birthday burger. Usually servers get upset about the whole free thing but my girl stayed sweet the whole time. I ordered one I had never tried before. The Ghost Pepper burger. They have two sizes for their Tavern selection burgers. Each of these come with two patties. So you can get a small one which is the same size patty of their regular burger or a large one which is two of their regular sized patties. I wasn't starved so I stuck with the small The burger itself had a little tiny kick to it. But as someone who loves spicy food, it wasn't spicy at all. It was good though! I had also substituted out sweet potato fries for regular fries and I couldn't stop eating them. Haha they were great! I was happy to find out they were bottomless too!  I've been to Red Robin before, just never had the chance to do a Yelp review on them. I've never had a bad burger from here. So I think they really appeal to the masses. They cater from the very picky to ultra fancy burger eaters and then everything in between with salads and normal entrees.  Bathrooms were really destroyed. The first stall I went into didn't have a hook for my purse. So I had to go into the one next to it. When I went to wash my hands the soap dispensers were off of the mirror and on the counter. Then the paper towels didn't work. I think they need matinee to come out really bad to fix a ton of things in there. It gives the restaurant this "trashy/we don't care" vibe. So while it wasn't the BEST burger I've ever had, it's definitely somewhere i'd take someone if they had never been before.

I love Red Robin! Yes, it's a chain, and they always offer all these new burgers that I always try and I'm semi-disappointed because the original gourmet burgers are always better, but it is just a good place to eat. One word: ONION RINGS. They are worth it. My favorite burger is the BANZAI BURGER. It has some teriyaki sauce and pineapple, basically a tropical burger. They also have a chicken version, if you're not a burger person. The FRECKLED LEMONADE is great, but it's gotten expensive. I usually only order water at restaurants, but this lemonade is yummy, with fresh strawberries. They have unlimited fries with other options as your side. The location is right outside the mall, pretty convenient for a before or after shopping meal!

First clue to bad restaurant is cleanliness of bathrooms. Fail upon first arriving to wash hands and overflowing garbage can of used paper towels and smell of uncleanliness. Back to seat and given dirty utensils. Around us sat a grandmother with toddlers. Obviously kid had "accident" and sat at table in diaper. Manager should have said something. Should have gotten up to leave but ate quickly. My husband says to me as we left, "did that place seem dirty?" YES! Filthy more like it. No one even said thank you for coming or bye as we left. Waitress all but said use the table kiosk to order, pay etc... Gee what happened to customer service?! But sure was prompted on screen to TIP. Will not return. Used to enjoy RR but this experience was GROSS!!! Oh and as busboy cleaned table next to us, did not wipe off highchair OR table!!!

Emma she was absolutely fantastic. She was helping our waitress named  Amelia .It was lunch time and packed . We were seated at the bar and our waitress Amelia was all over the place helping the family section and dealing with the bar  but she was juggling things pretty well. Emma was an absolute pleasure she made sure that my hamburger was altered she made sure my lemonade was perfect and my husband loved his margarita. These two girls made our day and it was my husband's birthday and they sang a lovely  song for us Amelia's doing :) . So if you go to this location to be sure to ask for these waitresses. Emma does not mess around. And Amelia is a sweetheart.

I only went to this restaurant because work friends picked it. I think Red Robin is overpriced for what you get. Anyway, the burger I got was decent. I had broccoli as a side and it was fine. My friend got a fried zucchini starter and it was undercooked. But my biggest issue was the server. She brought me sweet tea instead of unsweetened and when I told her, she apologized and said she'd bring the correct drink. Never happened. Asked for mayo. Got it when my burger was 3/4 of the way gone. Just not a great experience...average food and poor service. Won't be back.
Came here tonight to get dinner and we waited 20 minutes just for a waitress/waiter. No one came. The people that down after us got served. Very unsatisfactory.

Went this afternoon for lunch with our "gang" which is just 5 of us, we were told about 30 minutes wait which was obviously due to staffing issues as there were plenty of tables open, after 45 minutes and seeing quite a few groups of 3 and 4 come in and get seated ahead of us we asked about us, basically they said that they didn't have a table large enough for us (I guess they never thought about sliding two tables together), when we questioned the asst. Manager (Sil Diaz) about it, his response was "your welcome to leave" which we promply did, even managed to take a couple other groups with us just out of protest.  This was their second and last chance to redeem themselves in our eyes, the last time we were there, it was a 20 minute wait with about 10 people in the entire place, then to top it off, the food came out wrong and cold. If you value your time and hard earned dollars, stay away from this place, they will waist both of them for you.

When we walked in there was nobody at the hostess podium, so we waited. After 5 min a waitress walked past looked at us and didn't say a word just keep walking.  A few minutes later she came back and asked how many was in our party.  This part may be a little petty but still. Without asking if it was ok to sit in the bar area we had to ask for a different area that want so loud. She was not pleasant at all. Then we waited about 10 min Before we had anyone acknowledge us. A very nice man I later learned was the manager told us that he was sorry it was taking so long and that he was short today and was helping our server out. Dave our server came over again and apologized for taking so long. After we got our food I was disappointed that when you add jalapeños on the sandwich and on the side that you are charged twice for them.  We left happy and it was all because of the manager and David they turned the bad into good. I gave four out of five stars because nobody is perfect and five means perfect.

I love Red Robin burgers!  The service is always very good at this location.  I do prefer to deal with the server directly, but they have an option of using the electronic service and just getting items delivered to your table.  It is a nice way to pay if you are in a hurry.   My faves are the mushroom burger, fried chicken salad with honey mustard dressing, the original burger and the burger with the fried egg, I also enjoy the french dip and the endless fries.  Endless Fries People!  They have ton of dipping sauces for the fries, so you don't have to just use the katchup.  The drinks are also  tasty.  I think this is a great place for whole family - kids have nice options. I do not like to try out new items that rotate on their specials, so I can't say much about those. My son loves their buffalo chicken strips from the appetizer menu. You can't go wrong with taking your date here for casual food and a drink.

It's a bit disappointing when go to a restaurant, anxiously looking forward to getting there and enjoying what you have been looking forward to having... As the person (Hostess) that greets you and takes you to your table, was no where to be found after standing there for about 10-15 minutes I finally approached a waitress and asked for assistance.  After she informed she was not the hostess she finally took me to a table !!!  So now as I sit and wait for someone to finally show up to take my order or offer me a drink, but instead I witness a disagreement between the customer and waitress and management at the table next to me.  And even then after seeing me there the waitress never bothered to say anything except make eye contact and look away !!!! What a beginning to and evening dinner ???  Not only that, but she left for the night  a bit after the incident  without ever saying anything in reference to getting me another waitress ???  Not good business.  I finally had a waitress named Joy, come and take my order.  Even though where I was sitting at was not in her section she managed to take care of me plus the other tables she had. She did an excellent job !!!!  Sadly their machine had been broke for two days therefore I could not enjoy the milkshake I was looking forward to having with my meal !!  It was quite a disappointing experience. How can a business not be prepared for equipment failure ??? Since the milkshakes are just as popular as their burgers ???  Issues do happen, but you must also remember your customers deserve good customer service !!

Food was just "OK", nothing to brag about and the service was subpar. Sat at the bar, didn't like the "bar tender" (Angela's) non-chalant attitude. Food for thought to management; your employee's (especially when dealing with the public) should be friendly AND engaging with the customers (take some lessons from Chic-fil-a). Needless to say, I will not be back to this establishment.

I decided to go to red Robin because a friend of mine's flew in from Florida over the weekend and had never been there before. Our wait time was about 15 to 20 minutes which was no problem however my issue came once we were seated at the table.  Our servers name was "Jess"and as she started off in a pleasant way it certainly didn't last long. She took our drink orders and I asked for a water with lemon and everyone else had strawberry lemonade.  She left and came back to the table to bring the drinks and I reminded her that I would like a lemon for my water.  She said OK I will go and get it for you meanwhile we placed an order for appetizers.  While waiting for the appetizers and lemon she was at other tables (rightfully so) but I was hoping that she would bring the lemon because I don't drink water without lemon as it makes me feel queasy by itself. I also asked if we could have a basket of fries while we wait and she then stated "no you will get it when your meal arrives (in a nasty tone).  The appetizers arrived a little while later and of course I never got the lemon and at that point I just gave up and was about to place an order for a sweet tea (definitely wouldn't say with lemon). She came to the table to take our main orders and after placing our order I asked if I could switch my drink and just order a sweet tea instead and I mentioned because I never got my lemon. She then took her hand and banged it on the table very hard and said "I WILL GO AND GET YOUR LEMON NOW" in a very angry and sarcastic tone. My guests and I was COMPLETELY taken aback. There was a couple with children sitting across from us that turned to look at our table when they heard the bang on the table top. She proceeded to walk away and within minutes someone else came back a few minutes later with my lemon needless to say, I let the young lady know and had her pass it along to management.  Jess does. It need to work in an environment of providing service to customers on my opinion as there is no need to because irate and lose your cool over a lemon.  My guests said that they will never cost Red Robin again and i concur totally! Smh
I'm so torn about this place, so I'm going to err on the side of four stars instead of three, at least for now.

This Red Robin is very conveniently located but their service is just so awful. I've been here about 4-5 times and 2 of those times, one of which was tonight, was ordering to go. I won't dwell in my past experiences but tonight was just awful. I had ordered and about 20 minutes then went to pick up my food. Once getting there I headed towards the bar and the bartender proceeded to ask what I needed. I explained to her I placed an order to go and she said she'd go and get it. Once returning she completely ignored me and mentioned nothing about my meal and proceeded to fill her ice bucket. I waited for about 15 minutes and another woman asked what I was waiting for and said she'd check, well she never came back. Then after waiting about 30 minutes the bartender finally got my order and when I checked it, lo and behold it was cold. The food generally tastes ok but if you value your time and money just save yourself the hassle and go elsewhere.

Really enjoyed the Whiskey River BBQ burger!  Cooked perfectly and had unlimited fries!  My friend had fries and I had broccoli as a side.  Great choices and great service!  Our server Brittany was fantastic .  We will definitely be back!

My husband and I usually come here with absolutely no problems; however, we had the worst take-out experience possible.  When they, (the kitchen staff) know the foods is a to-go order this means do the absolute worst you possibly can? We are frequent dinners at this location and have never in countered such bad food and so so service as this.  Both bartenders were somewhat busy so the fact that they charged us for a $5.39 Belgium beer we never had.........    we happened to walk in with a complete stranger; however, even though we said we're NOT with him she (the bartender) thought we were. Not completely her fault because the guy was a little bit of a jerk and kidding around with her. My husband is the sweetest man put on earth, he volunteered to just pay for the guys beer, so we did, no big deal..... Then there was the food. The food was some of the worst we've ever had here. We had a plain burger with lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles and a teriyaki chicken sandwich hold everything, but the teriyaki sauce, fries with both.  When we got home, which only took about 10 minutes we discovered that we had a plain burger burnt black with absolutely nothing on it. This burger was so burnt it was uneatable.  In the box with the burger was a random piece of bacon and a piece of plastic, sort of melted to a fry.  By-the-way the fries were cold, lol.  The teriyaki chicken wasn't too bad, but in that box was a random piece of onion and macerated piece of lettuce. The fries were just awful; cold hard flavorless.  All-in-all this was just completely poor quality control.  To keep food hot, line the bottom of the box with the foil burger paper. Here's another freebie, put a paper napkin in the box sandwiched between the foil and fries. This will absorb the steam moisture and keep the fries from getting mushy, cold and hard.  My husband and I have probably had our last meal at this location.

Stopped in mid afternoon yesterday after traveling all day up to that point.  Tired and hungry I was waited on by Briana, who had a great attitude and a welcome smile. I asked her for some recommendations which were all excellent. She even personally made me a shake that wasn't on the menu, telling me it was her own favorite.  It should be added to their menu!  Love Red Robin's burgers and yesterday was no exception.  Excellent food and great service with a smile.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Thanks Briana!

Order took a long time to come out. Not overly busy for a Tuesday but a good crowd and steady turnover. Attentive server. Ordered bacon cheeseburger with cheddar, onions and tomatoes. Well done. Of course I am having onion rings and a Dr. Pepper. Burger is perfect, just how I like it. Onion rings are nice and crunchy and not greasy. This was a great choice for dinner tonight.

Contrary to popular belief, it is incredibly difficult to cook a hamburger properly.  I would rate myself as a pretty good cook but I have NEVER mastered the art of properly cooking a hamburger.  It's a great sadness!  The Red Robin comes fairly close but they just missed the mark on this day.  My cheeseburger should have been medium but it was well done. The thing that saved it was that it wasn't dry, stick in your throat.  I'm guessing they removed it from the flattop when it had just turned medium well and so it didn't dry out as it continued to cook off the heat.  I guess I'm saying it wasn't  perfect but it was still tasty and certainly not a burger I would send back to the kitchen. I like their steak fries and the service was very good.  It was the best burger I have eaten in a while.  So, 4 stars for this Red Robin this time.

I went to another locations YEARS ago and thought it was horrible.  My best friend came into town and she suggested Red Robin. I decided to be a good ol pal and acted nonchalant and said that I've never been there!  Glad I didn't tell her how disgusted I was my first visit.  I got the tavern cheese burger. SOOOO GOODDDDD with endless broccoli!!! I love that it wasn't drenched in butter. I know butter is the best thing on Earth, but I've been trying to get a girlish figure.  My toddler ate his entire kid meal - he was a fan of the cheeseburger as well. I stole a fry and wasn't too impressed w the fries but my in-the-works-girlish-figure was really happy I didn't steal any more.  We'll be back!!!
I used to love this place, The last few visits, service has been slow, fries have been nearly cold and on today's visit ....the bathroom really needed attention and toilet paper!
I was hoping for a "great" quality angus burger. I got an ok burger. Maybe I was expecting too much. Costs are low. Had to wait for extra fries.

The burgers are not bad, but nothing to rave about. The endless fries are okay, but soft and not crunchy. You'll get a much better burger across the mall at Pop's Diner. Oh, and no Guest WiFi? Get with the times. Staff is very friendly and willing to make your visit a pleasure.

Place was less than half full of customers. Waited 15 minutes at our table and a server never showed. We left. Servers were delivering food past us the entire time and not one of them stopped to acknowledge that we were there. We even hit the table kiosk "help" button. Te machine kept blinking and blinking red.  Nothing even after that.  Poor level of service.

We were in the mood for burgers and we all decided on Red Robin. After saying the punch line on our way we were immediately in awe over the amount of people on the wait list. We were able to get on the make shift list for the bar area and after about 5 minutes waiting for our anticipated 30 minute wait we were seated and greeted with never ending French fries. Our waiter was pretty awesome and I ended up ordering the southern charm burger with a side of fresh jalapeños and a not your fathers root beer float. The burger was the Red Robin standard of over cooked but it had good flavor. The fries are always tasty and the Not Ypur Fathers hit the spot.
This place deserves a far better rating than 3 stars. I thoroughly enjoyed my good coma!

We love Red Robin's burgers especially the gourmet specialty ones. The service and the staff are always so welcoming and very prompt on getting our drinks and orders out efficiently and correctly. We probably come to this location maybe once a month. It's definitely our go to for burgers because they are sOooo YUMMMMM!

I came in with my family to enjoy a nice meal  & was highly disappointed. The Macaroni and cheese was so dry I couldn't even bare to swallow it. The drinks were gross & my my burger had tomatoes on it after requesting to have it taken off. My mom ordered a clam chowder soup for $3 and literally got two tablespoons of soup. I've been a customer at Red Robin for several years..After my experience tonight I definitely will not be coming back. It was an epic fail...

Good food.  Good service.  Was disappointed in management because of there lack of response when I found a fly in my drink. They did not compensate nor provide proper explanation other than saying they did believe it was in the drink when they brought it to the table.   I felt as if it was our fault the fly was in my drink.    It will be a while before I go back to this location.

This was our first time at RR.  Lunch on a Thursday.  We were seated immediately.  Our server Sydney was a rock star!  She explained the process and specials and made recommendations.We went with the Tavern Cheeseburgers, one with salad one and with fries.  The burgers were delicious.  The fries hot and crispy but soft and fluffy inside.  The salad was standard, which was fine.  I like being able to view the bill and pay from the table.  I had mistakenly tapped on an app but it was promptly removed from the bill.  The gentleman who was the manager that day checked on us twice and we had a nice conversation.  The portions were perfect and we will be back to indulge a little for dinner.  All in all a five star experience.

We came in about 30 mins before closing and the staff never made us feel like we had to hurry. Service was great. We ordered the onion rings tower as an appetizer and it was perfect! For my entree I had ordered garlic fries instead of the regular fries and that unfortunately was a mistake. They were super greasy. The grease spilled over to my burger causing the bun to be super greasy and soggy so that wasn't fun to eat. Other than that everything else was great. I'll just get regular fries next time.

I've come here maybe once every other month for the last 7 years, it used to be awesome and now it's very hit and miss but it's been declining severely over the past year or 2. I don't know if they don't train the servers well enough but we have a chronic issue with very poor service here. This past time we went the service was honestly miserable, to the point I just wanted to leave. And we've had this waiter several times so it's not like he was new. He took like 10 minutes getting my daughter her chocolate milk, forgot my husbands coffee twice, spent about 10 minutes getting my husband his side of honey mustard, we had barely a handful of fries each and when I asked for a refill he literally NEVER brought one, and we ordered milkshakes and they were in tiny kids drink cups that (including whipped cream) were barely halfway full. Literally the entire shake was about 5 sips. We were furious, what a rip off. I don't know if we'll ever come back to be honest and it's a shame

Gourmet Burgers is a stretch....Giving 2 stars because they didnt charge for trying to get it correct twice. A place that basically only sells "gourmet" burgers should be able to not turn it into a hockey puck. My opinion.
Ants, cold food, burnt burger. Usually, good experiences at RR and have always been a fan, but surprisingly disappointed by this location.

I just went last night to this location... quickly sent to be seated and drinks were ordered...  appetizer was super delayed IMAGINE the order! It took more then 30 minutes to get our order... I ordered The Southern Charm: they forgot the onions, the bacon was regular bacon. It's supposed to be caramelized onions and bacon, nope, didn't happened. The freckle lemonade was served with more ice then the drink, every time my daughter or I did tried to drink from our glass either a strawberry or the ice was in the straw...  I couldn't finish the burger, I ordered medium and it came back burnt.  I told the waitress to tell the manager, the manager NEVER came to our table, on our way out, I asked the waitress if she told the manager, she said "yes, but we are short of managers tonight, sorry"  WOW!!! Money waisted last night.   I'm sure NOT coming back to that location.

I feel that red Robin has really gone down hill.  I went here on New Year's Eve. I feel like it's a great place to bring a toddler or a kid...because it is usually loud and no one will notice your toddler being a little crazy. Our wait to be seated didn't take long. While we were waiting I took my son to change his diaper and wash his hands. As I was walking towards the bathroom there were chairs in the way of the door. I was carrying my baby and a diaper bag and a purse. I had to use my feet to shove them aside...then I went into the bathroom and sat my son onto the changing table...has this that ever been clean! It was filthy and disgusting and same with the rest of the bathroom. It's just gross! If the bathroom is dirty imagine what the kitchen looks like!  Once we got seated. Our waiter seemed really friendly. We ordered and got our food not too long after. I was very disappointed. The was not hot. The fries were hard...my son's pizza was burnt..also our waiter was terrible at picking up plates that we were done with and refilling drinks. He even said and I quote "I'm so terrible at busing up my tables...like all my tables are messy"...after seeing how unclean this place can be. I don't think I'll be coming here anymore, and stick with going to the Newport News one.

I had SUCH a great, easy experience today. I placed my order online in the car to go and I went inside and sat at the bar area and had a drink while I waited for it. Service was great. My burger was ready in about TEN MINUTES! So, not a bad wait at all and it was right around the lunch rush. I forgot the name of the burger, but it was the one that comes with American cheese, bacon and a fried egg. I added avocado and got it on a lettuce wrap (trying to watch my figure ;)) and it was awesome. They even give you the option to get EXTRA fries, since you get bottomless fries when you dine in. Everything was hot, minus the lettuce and it was FRESH. I didn't have to wonder if I was eating something that was left over from the night before like at a popular wing establishment that I visited last week. Mattie was the one who brought out my food and they even give you MORE fries to eat in the car in a cute little cup! Excellent job Red Robin.
